item.title: Scott, Tony 'The Cart, the Horse, and the Road they are Driving Down: Thinking Ecologically About a New Writing Major.'
item.description: One Liner Marxist and labor based analysis of the major and the discipline that encourages a deeper understanding of the connections between what we do in the writing classroom and the institutional means by which it is done. Summary “Writing majors will need to be developed mindful of how current instituional practices already shape the ongoing concerns and work of the field” (88). Tony Scott argues that by examining the curriculum of writing classrooms, and then writing majors, we can examine how the material relations of power that exist through the classroom.
